Dialogue:
DG: Good evening.  
BA: Good evening.  
DG: Do you listen to music?  
BA: Yes, I listen to Western music.  
DG: That's cool.  
BA: Thanks.  
DG: I might have a lot of Japanese music that I enjoy.  
BA: What songs do you often listen to?  
DG: I've been listening to L'Arc-en-Ciel and King Gnu for a long time.  
BA: I'm not familiar with them.  
DG: What kind of Western music do you enjoy?  
BA: I like Justin Bieber.  
DG: I've heard of him.  
BA: Have you listened to any of his songs?  
DG: Yes, but I don't remember the titles. He's quite famous, right?  
BA: Yes, he's very famous.  
DG: Have you been to any live concerts recently?  
BA: Not recently. It was a while ago.  
DG: I imagine seeing international artists can be difficult.  
BA: Tickets are usually easy to get. Have you attended any live shows recently?  
DG: No, but I'm planning to go to Summer Sonic soon.  
BA: Is Summer Sonic happening soon?  
DG: Yes, it's next week. I'm a bit worried about COVID-19 restrictions.  
BA: Which overseas artists are performing?  
DG: THE19 will be there.  
BA: I'm not familiar with that artist.  
DG: I always get confused with historical eras.  
BA: Is it related to era names?  
DG: Yes, I couldn't go past 19. Thanks for the help.  
BA: LOL, you're welcome.

DG: Nice to meet you!  
DV: Hello, nice to meet you too.  
DG: Have you been into anything lately?  
DV: Watching quiz shows at home.  
DG: That sounds fun and educational.  
DV: I thought it might be good for brain activation.  
DG: Definitely. Some of the questions can be really challenging.  
DV: I find it hard to recall things even after studying.  
DG: We all forget things we don't use often.  
DV: I worry my child might soon be smarter than me.  
DG: Kids can really push us to keep learning.  
DV: If my child said, "You don't understand this?", I wouldn't be able to sleep.  
DG: That would be frustrating for sure.  
DV: We tend to forget things we don't use regularly.  
DG: Absolutely. What was your favorite subject?  
DV: Mathematics.  
DG: Mine was different.  
DV: I liked having definitive answers in math.  
DG: Math enthusiasts often say that.  
DV: Language subjects can be ambiguous and vary by grader.  
DG: True, that can be quite annoying.  
DV: There are many "this isn't wrong, but..." situations in those subjects.  
DG: Yes, I enjoyed reading books.  
DV: I also loved reading and spent a lot of time in the library.  
DG: Classical literature wasn't my favorite.  
DV: Classical Japanese was challenging.  
DG: I got bored with kanji drills. There are more interesting learning materials now.  
DV: Yes, many types of drills are available nowadays.  
DG: Learning materials today sound engaging.  
DV: I'll need to get some for the kids soon.

DG: Hello!  
DV: Hello!  
DG: At what time does "good evening" start?  
DV: "Good evening" typically starts around 5 PM.  
DG: I hadn't thought about that.  
DV: Evening usually begins at 5 PM.  
DG: I just realized, people overseas always say 'hello.'  
DV: The Japanese language is indeed complex.  
DG: It's difficult because it's so detailed in various ways.  
DV: Yes, different speaking styles can significantly change the impression.  
DG: There are so many homophones, it’s overwhelming.  
DV: It does seem challenging for foreigners to learn Japanese.  
DG: When I spoke Japanese on the phone overseas, I was happy to hear that the sound was clear.  
DV: That must have been gratifying. Have you traveled abroad? Which country did you visit?  
DG: I stayed with a host family in Australia.  
DV: That sounds interesting.  
DG: As an only child, it was refreshing to have siblings.  
DV: Was it a long-term stay or short-term?  
DG: High school was continuous. I experienced severe homesickness.  
DV: It's understandable to feel homesick after a prolonged period.  
DG: Yes, and the different food made me feel lonely.  
DV: Did you miss rice?  
DG: I missed Japanese food, like fish! It was all meat.  
DV: Is it true that Australia has more meat despite being surrounded by the ocean?  
DG: Yes, there was plenty of Aussie beef and lamb steak.  
DV: Aussie beef and lamb steak are quite popular.  
DG: With the low-fat content, I lost weight when I returned.  
DV: It seems like a healthy option.  
DG: Yes, but a bit dry. It was interesting.  
DV: Thank you for sharing your experience!

DG: Hello.
DV: How can I assist you today?
DG: Do you have any favorite artists or celebrities?
DV: I liked GLAY when I was younger.
DG: Are they still performing?
DV: They sometimes perform in Hokkaido. Nationwide status is unclear.
DG: Local focus is nice.
DV: They had a large concert in Hokkaido recently.
DG: Do you attend concerts?
DV: I prefer watching DVDs.
DG: That makes sense.
DV: Live concerts can be overwhelming.
DG: Each artist has a unique style.
DV: Crowds can be very enthusiastic.
DG: Were most fans male?
DV: Both genders were very enthusiastic.
DG: Like an idol concert? Not really my thing.
DV: I prefer DVDs now.
DG: Felt out of place at a Yuzu concert once.
DV: Yuzu concerts seem less intense.
DG: Energetic, but can be overwhelming.
DV: Are all concerts like that?
DG: Prefer sitting and listening calmly.
DV: A relaxed concert would be nice.
DG: Dislike standing all the time.
DV: Feel obligated to stand if others do.
DG: Hard to relax like that.
DV: DVDs are better.
DG: Agreed.
DV: Indeed.

DG: Hello!  
DV: Hi there! How can I assist you today?  
DG: It's hot, and I feel like going to the aquarium.  
DV: The dolphin show might be refreshing; you could get splashed. That sounds fun!  
DG: Yes, I heard about dolphins coming to the sea recently.  
DV: There was a news report about that. Interesting, right?  
DG: Apparently, a child was bitten a little at the beach.  
DV: Yes, some were reported bitten. They look cute but can be scary. It's important to stay cautious.  
DG: I heard they're mischievous but strong.  
DV: Their size means even slight force can cause injury.  
DG: True, but their jumps are impressive and worth watching. I love those moments.  
DV: There used to be an event to touch dolphins, and they felt smooth. I remember it well.  
DG: That sounds great! I wonder what it feels like.  
DV: Smooth to the touch. It was a unique experience.  
DG: I bet their muscles are strong because they can jump so high.  
DV: There was also a feeding experience, but the timing didn’t match. It's a shame.  
DG: I would love to try that.  
DV: It was memorable.  
DG: I like to cool off by watching the shark tank.  
DV: Sharks can be scary, but some are gentle. It’s fascinating.  
DG: I like hammerhead sharks. I’m curious about their head shape.  
DV: The square-looking one?  
DG: My friends call me a vacuum cleaner because of it! I get teased, but it's all in good fun.  
DV: That’s a creative nickname!  
DG: Yes, it’s cute even though I get teased.  
DV: My child likes whale sharks.  
DG: They’re big and gentle! I want to see one.  
DV: I saw one at the Okinawa aquarium; it was wonderful.  
DG: The Churaumi Aquarium, right? I want to visit.  
DV: I recommend it!

DG: Nice to meet you!  
DV: Hello, nice to meet you.  
DG: I haven’t been going out much lately and haven't bought any new clothes. Have you purchased anything recently?  
DV: I bought pants through online shopping.  
DG: Online shopping has become more common, hasn't it? I usually shop at Uniqlo.  
DV: They offer pants you can adjust yourself by cutting the hem.  
DG: Really? I wasn't aware of that.  
DV: Yes, the material doesn't fray when cut.  
DG: That's useful!  
DV: It's helpful for people who find the hems too long.  
DG: I dislike when the hem gets dirty from the ground.  
DV: Especially on rainy days.  
DG: Exactly. The hem often fades.  
DV: I used to wear heels and high-heeled boots.  
DG: Nowadays, I prefer more comfortable shoes.  
DV: I've been wearing sneakers lately and paying attention to hem length.  
DG: There are many sporty options like sneakers and sandals.  
DV: That's when I discovered the adjustable hem pants.  
DG: It's great that such products are available.  
DV: I ordered them immediately.  
DG: It's nice to find exactly what you need.  
DV: When they arrived, I found the fabric perfect for the season.  
DG: I think I might look for new clothes too.  
DV: They were so good I bought another pair in a different color.  
DG: That sounds impressive!  
DV: I plan to wear them a lot this summer.  
DG: I’ve been wearing skirts recently, but I'll search for some pants.  
DV: I recommend it.  
DG: Thanks for the information!  
DV: You're welcome.

DG: Good evening!
DV: Good evening!
DG: I've been staying up late recently. Should I go to bed early?
DV: Going to bed early is recommended.
DG: It sounds like having a family helps with a consistent bedtime.
DV: My kids usually sleep by 9 PM.
DG: That's early. Sleeping early is good for the skin, right?
DV: Yes, but I prefer some time for myself after that.
DG: Personal time is important. It must be tough with kids.
DV: The TV is often occupied by the kids.
DG: You deserve some TV time too.
DV: I'd like to watch TV in peace.
DG: If you had a free day, what would you do?
DV: I'd shop slowly or relax.
DG: Being single, I realize how tough parenting can be.
DV: Free days are rare with kids.
DG: It must be hard to maintain friendships.
DV: It's difficult to go out without the kids.
DG: Choices and schedules must change a lot.
DV: We mostly eat at child-friendly places.
DG: Finding restaurants must be hard. Do you use social media recommendations?
DV: We go where the kids want, not often to Italian places.
DG: So, it's usually family-friendly restaurants?
DV: Yes, mostly family chains.
DG: I should enjoy spicy foods while I can.
DV: Conveyor belt sushi is good, but my kid doesn't eat sushi.
DG: There are many preferences and allergies to consider.
DV: Enjoy what you like while you can!
DG: I'll take your advice. Let's eat mapo tofu!
DV: Sounds good!

DG: Nice to meet you. Please assist me.
DV: Sure, happy to help.

DG: It's really hot today, isn't it?
DV: Yes, the temperature is very high.

DG: I saw it's 40 degrees outside.
DV: 40 degrees is quite extreme.

DG: Indeed. Did you have lunch?
DV: I had ramen.

DG: Ramen on such a hot day! What was it like?
DV: Soy sauce flavored.

DG: Handmade? Soy sauce sounds good even in summer.
DV: Yes, with onions.

DG: Finely chopped onions?
DV: Thinly sliced onions and chopped green onions.

DG: I love dishes with green onions.
DV: They are good for summer fatigue.

DG: I usually eat instant noodles.
DV: Homemade food is healthier.

DG: Instant noodles have a lot of salt.
DV: Yes, they do.

DG: Spicy food makes my body feel heavy.
DV: Making it yourself lets you use more vegetables.

DG: I might have noodles tonight.
DV: Smooth foods are good when you lack appetite.

DG: Rice and bread need more effort to eat.
DV: Noodles with meat and vegetables are convenient.

DG: It's handy because it's all in one plate.
DV: Noodles on summer nights are recommended.

DG: I'll consider it.
DV: Understood.

DG: Hello!  
DV: Hello!  
DG: Lately, I've been spending a lot of time at home and becoming less active.  
DV: Physical inactivity can lead to weight gain.  
DG: Do you know of any gymnastics or yoga routines?  
DV: I don't have information on specific routines.  
DG: I often watch instructional videos but fail to follow through.  
DV: Noted.  
DG: DVDs used to be popular for this, right?  
DV: Yes, many would watch once and then stop.  
DG: I do the same with YouTube—watch but don’t act.  
DV: Many options are available.  
DG: I tried doing simple stretches before bed for a week but then stopped.  
DV: Short activities can be hard to maintain.  
DG: Yes, I wonder about their effectiveness.  
DV: They can be challenging to keep up with.  
DG: I once joined a gym but ended up making excuses to avoid going.  
DV: Understood.  
DG: It was expensive, and concerns over infections made me hesitant.  
DV: Infections are a significant concern.  
DG: Also, some gym-goers make a lot of noise on machines.  
DV: It's tough to exercise indoors with a mask on.  
DG: I'm becoming more of a neat freak these days.  
DV: Regular disinfection may become a habit.  
DG: I even bought a large disinfectant spray.  
DV: Excessive use might affect immunity.  
DG: I wonder how this impacts small children.  
DV: Children might have fewer chances to build their immunity.  
DG: Yes, there are many disinfectants and antibacterial products now.  
DV: I hope the coronavirus situation improves soon.

DG: Hello!
DV: Hello! How can I assist you today?
DG: Do you enjoy coffee?
DV: Yes, I drink it every morning.
DG: I love morning coffee, but I tend to overdo it.
DV: I drink a PET bottle in the morning.
DG: Do you like it black or sweetened?
DV: Only black.
DG: You must be a true coffee lover!
DV: Yes, black coffee feels the most authentic.
DG: Do you usually drink from PET bottles or buy beans?
DV: I used to buy beans, but it became too much effort.
DG: I'm thinking about getting a coffee machine. Any advice?
DV: I have a capsule-based coffee machine.
DG: Is it Nespresso? I've seen those.
DV: Yes, they're convenient but require maintenance.
DG: Are there a lot of parts to clean?
DV: Yes, it can be quite tedious.
DG: I saw a long line at the booth and didn't get to taste it. Is it worth it?
DV: I used it initially, but now it's just sitting there.
DG: I might end up the same way. I want to avoid a bad purchase.
DV: That might be because I prefer iced coffee.
DG: Is making iced coffee with that machine difficult?
DV: Yes, you need a lot of ice.
DG: That sounds complicated. I'm not sure what to do.
DV: For customers, a different machine might be better.
DG: It doesn't seem practical for daily use. I need something easy for mornings.
DV: For personal use, convenience is key.
DG: Thanks for the advice. I need to reconsider.
DV: Glad I could help.
